sentence: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at a record high on Tuesday, bringing up the S&P 500 and Nasdaq, with the financial sector contributing to the market's overall strength ahead of Q3 earnings from the banking sector.

Shares of component stock Walmart ( WMT ) were also a factor in the Dow's comfortable lead after the retail giant reiterated upbeat 2018 EPS and revenue guidance, as well as announced a plan to buy back $20 billion in stock.

After striking a record high at the open, stocks pulled away from their intraday highs midday in response to Procter & Gamble's ( PG ) decision to keep activist investor Nelson Peltz off the board, and ahead of a pivotal speech by the president of Catalonia who many feared would declare the region's independence from Spain.
Peltz vowed to fight on, and Carles Puidgemont deferred a declaration of independence pending international mediation.

Despite an underlying bid for safe havens like gold and U.S. Treasuries, the Dow climbed back towards its record high, assisted by sizable gains from Walmart and Boeing ( BA ), while strength in energy and airline stocks bolstered the S&P 500.
The Nasdaq struggled under the weight of losses in FANG stocks, but managed a modest gain on strength in biotechs.

Here's where the markets stood at the close:

(+) ROKA (+134.57%) A2A Pharmaceuticals may be making an acquisition play

(+) ANAB (+101.17%) Reported positive results from phase 2 clinical trial of ANB020 for atopic dermatitis
